mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rural delivery routes in Virginia: a collection of county maps issued by the United States Post Office Dept
Maps of rural delivery routes in Virginia, by county
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: United States. Post Office Department [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: <30> maps : photocopies ; 128 x 128 cm. or smaller
mdRecord.dcterms:description: FOLDER 1: Appomattox, no. 1057 -- Arlington, no. 1363 -- Augusta, no. 1123 -- Bedford, no. 1018 -- Botetourt, no. 1763 -- Campbell, no. 1758 -- Charles City, no. 1521 -- FOLDER 2: Fairfax, no. 1334 -- Floyd, no. 1155 -- Grayson, no. 1856 -- Greensville, no. 1536 -- Halifax, no visible no. -- Henrico, no. 1010 -- Isle of Wight, no. 1779 -- FOLDER 3: Loudoun, no. 986 -- Orange, no. 754 -- Pittsylvania, no. 1021 -- Prince Edward, Farmville (Brown liine) -- Prince George. 1845 -- Prince William, no. 1665 -- Pulaski, no. 1069 -- Rockbridge no. 1669 -- Rockingham, no. 759 -- Shenandoah, no. 1059 -- FOLDER 4: Southampton, no. 1644 -- Suffolk, No. 1-2/4, (1908/1909) -- Surry, no. 1427 -- Sussex, no. 1653 -- Washington, no. 1106 -- Wise, no. 1543 -- Wythe, no. 1149.
Arranged alphabetically by name of county. [original]
Maps generally show: Post offices, Roads, Routes, Churches, Schools and Houses, often with names of local residents. [original]
Most maps have library acquisition date stamp of 1937. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Postal service--Virginia--Maps
Rural free delivery--Virginia--Maps
